channel.title: How to Install Linux on your Ipod Nano!
channel.description:
------------------------------------------------------------------
To start, I'll kill all of you worries here!
[i]"It is impossible to permanently damage your iPod by installing iPod Linux!"[/i]
Also, please make a note that this tutorial is meant for the iPod Nano. You may get success with this tutorial using another iPod, but I can't guarantee it.
If you have an iPod Video, there's a nice tutorial [url=http://ipodlinux.org/forums/viewtopic.php?t=26543][b]Here[/b][/url], and if you have an iPod Mini, you can find a tutorial [url=http://ipodlinux.org/forums/viewtopic.php?t=6099][b]Here[/b][/url]. If you have an iPod not listed here, just search the forums or ask someone.
Ok, let's get started
Note: If you don't already have Winzip, get it [url=http://www.winzip.com][b]Here[/b][/url] (You probably have it already, so only download this if you have a problem Extracting files)
1) Grab your iPod!
2) Open iTunes, which should be on your desktop or in the start menu. If you don't have it, grab the disc that came with your iPod and install it, or download the latest version [url=http://www.apple.com/itunes/download/][b]Here[/b][/url] (PM me if you need more explanation)
Note: Make sure you have iPod Software Version 1.3.1, PM me for more help.
3) Once iTunes is open, plug in your iPod using your cable. Your iPod should pop-up, and click it in the source list. (PM me for extra help)
4) Enable disk use, which is done by clicking "Enable Disk Use". Once this is done, hit apply.
5) Note: from now on, you MUST hit the eject button next to the iPod every time you want to unplug it, but wait until it is done updating of course! Unplug it when the screen on your iPod stops saying "Do Not Disconnect". BUT DON'T UNPLUG IT NOW!
6) Hit "Restore" and relax when it says it will restore your iPod to factory settings. This is ok! Here's what will happen. First, it will reset your settings and take all the music off of your iPod. Next, you will install iPod Linux. After that, the music will get put back on, so make sure all of your music is stored on your computer. So basically, your ipod will be EXACTLY the same except for iPod Linux, which is only accessed if you choose so. As a matter of fact, if you don't go into Linux on your iPod, it's like it didn't ever get installed. Hit "Ok" when the next message pops up, and wait until your iPod is restored. When it is, it will ask for the name of the iPod. Hit "Cancel".
5) EXIT out of iTunes, and open My Computer. It is usually on your desktop, though sometimes it is in the start menu. Select it, and somewhere there it should say "IPOD".
6) If it is there, then continue on. If not, go back to step 4, and do it again. If it doesn't work, come to me for help.
7) Download [url=http://www.josh.sys-techs.com/installer/ipodlinux-installer-2.2w-netless-20060709.zip][b]This[/b][/url], it is the official Linux Installer, but a different version.
8 ) Hit "Save" and save it on your Desktop. Wait for it to download, and then come back here.
9) Right-click the file you downloaded, and hit "Extract All". Hit next, let the bar load, then hit next and then finish. The file should pop-up. Exit out of the file.
10) Time to install! Open the file again and double click on installer. It should pop-up, and hit next. There SHOULD be a Sysinfo error. This is a good thing! Well, not good, but we can fix it! If it says it couldn't find anything that looked like an iPod, PM me for help. Ok, now for a little harder part. Close everything except this tutorial, and open "My Computer". Double click on your iPod. You are now in the iPod's root. (Make sure you are exited out of iTunes but did not unplug your iPod or eject it).
11) Now that you are in the root, hit "Tools" at the top of the browser. Hit "Folder Options" and a screen should pop-up.
12) Hit "View" at the top of this pop-up, and a new screen should pop-up! Scroll down, and hit "Show hidden files and folders". Hit "Ok" at the bottom of the screen and go back to your iPod. Open it up, and you are in the root again.
13) New folder! Do you see "iPod_Control"? If you do then good, if now, repeat steps 11 and 12. If it still doesn't work, come to me for help. If it does, then double-click on "iPod_Control". Once inside, it should have more folders. Double click on "Device". Once inside, there should be a file called "SysInfo". Right click on this file and hit "Open". Select the program "Notepad" from the list and hit ok. A screen should pop-up with nothing on it. Copy and paste this in there, replace the "Serial Number Here" with the serial number on the back of your iPod, and then save it and exit.
Copy and Paste this:
BoardHwName: iPod M25 pszSerialNumber: SERIAL NUMBER GOES HERE ModelNumStr: MA147 FirewireGuid: 0x000A2700148EDA63 HddFirmwareRev: BU011A RegionCode: LL(0x0001) PolicyFlags: 0x00000002 buildID: 0x06008000 (6.0) visibleBuildID: 0x01008000 (1.0) boardHwRev: 0x00000000 (0.0 0) boardHwSwInterfaceRev: 0x000C0005 (0.0.11 5) bootLoaderImageRev: 0x00000000 (0.0 0) diskModeImageRev: 0x00000000 (0.0 0) diagImageRev: 0x00000000 (0.0 0) osImageRev: 0x00000000 (0.0 0) iPodFamily: 0x00000000 updaterFamily: 0x00000000
14) Ok, exit out of everything except this tutorial, and go back into the installer (the thing you downloaded) and hit "Installer" again.
15) Hit "Next", and it should say "We have detected a Nano" blah blah blah blah. Hit next.
16) Uncheck "Make A Backup" at the bottom of the screen and hit next.
17) Then, it should install. This takes awhile, so you can leave if you want.
18 ) After awhile, it should pop-up a congradulations message. If it pops up a Windows error, then PM me for help. Hit "Finish".
19) iPod Linux is now installed on your iPod! Open up iTunes again, and the same screen should pop-up. Enter the iPod's name, yada yada, and it should put all of your music on there. Once it is done, select your iPod in the list again, and "Enable Disk Use", once again.
20) You now have iPod Linux installed!
21) Hit the eject button next to your iPod in the source list and when your iPod's screen stops saying "Do Not Disconnect" then disconnect it. It should have you select a language, and your iPod will be back to normal. Where's the Linux? First, go into your music and play 1 song to make sure it works. If it doesn't then come to me and I will fix it. If it works, then stop the song and hold down the "Menu" and "Center" button at the same time. Nothing should happen for a second, but then your iPod should black out. When a silver apple appears, hold rewind. When a bunch of text comes up, release "Rewind". It should pause for a second, and then go to a new menu. Hold "Menu" for a second and the backlight should turn on. You can change its timer in "Settings". Go into "Extras" and have some fun in there. Once your done, go to the main screen and hit "Power" then "Reboot Ipod" then "Absolutely" and it will go back to your normal iPod. -------------------------------------------------------------------- Linux Troubleshooting
"When I select "Reboot iPod" it boots right back into iPod Linux!"
It's important that when the iPod is rebooting that you don't touch ANYTHING! Like, don't even look at it! :D Well, while you can look at it, it is possible to boot into Linux just by breathing on the click-wheel. --------------------------------------------------------------------
iDoom Tutorial:
Note: You MAY need to fix the VT Switching to get this to work. PM me for help.
1) Download [url=http://files.filefront.com//;5996769;;/][b]This[/b][/url]
If you need extra help, PM me
2) Extract this to the root of your iPod (remember this from before?) If not, PM me.
3) Take all the folders you extracted and put them in a new folder called "iDoom"
4) Sync your iPod (update on earlier versions) and then eject it.
5) Boot iPod Linux, and hit "File Browser"
6) Go into "iPod_Control"
7) Hit "Parent Directory"
8 ) Select the "iDoom" folder
9) Go inside it, and hit "iDoom" not "iDoom.cfg", etc.
Note: My way of getting into iDoom (through iPod_Control) is my way to get to "iDoom" even though not many people do it that way. If it doesn't work, get to it through "hp" in the file browser menu.
iDoom Troubleshooting
Problem: A stream of code comes down, and then it goes back to the File Browser!
Answer: Reboot, Click "Power" in the main Podzilla menu and hit "Reboot iPod"
------------------------------------------------------------------- Make Your Own Custom iDoom Maps!
1) Get Doom Builder [url=http://www.doombuilder.com/builder_download.php][b]Here[/b][/url]
2) Download this to the Desktop
3) Download the iDoom original folder again (it can be found in the iDoom tutorial section)
4) Extract the iDoom folder and the Doom Builder folder
5) Install Doom Builder, and copy and paste the .wad in the folder "iDoom" to the Desktop.
6) Right click the .wad, go to "Open With" and select "Doom Builder".
7) When the next screen pops-up, pull down the drop down menu at the top of the window and select "Doom".
8 ) Hit "Ok" and ignore the IWAD error messages
9) Edit your map, just toy around to get the feel for Doom Builder, try starting off by adding or editing some items.
10) When you're done editing, hit "Save" and ignore the IWAD error messages.
11) On the Desktop, your edited .wad as well as a backup file should be there.
12) Delete the backup file
13) Plug in your iPod, and go into the root
14) Replace your current .wad in the folder "iDoom" with the one you just edited.
15) Boot into iPod Linux, go into "hp" and then select the folder "iDoom"
16) To enter iDoom, select the file "iDoom", not the "iDoom" configuration file.
17) Have fun!
Troubleshooting For Making Your Own Custom iDoom Maps!
Problem: The game freezes!
Answer: Something is wrong with your map
----------------------------------------
Problem: A stream of code comes down, and then it goes back to the File Browser!
Answer: Reboot, Click "Power" in the main Podzilla menu and hit "Reboot iPod"
------------------------------------------------- Video Tutorial
1) Download [url=http://www.megaupload.com/?d=QAU7CPV0][b]This[/b][/url] is has everything you need, except for videos!
2) "Save" it to the Desktop of your computer
3) Once it is downloaded, "Extract" the compressed folder you just downloaded.
4) Rename the "Extracted" folder "Videos"
5) Open "Videos"
6) Delete the "sMooVePoD0.7" folder
7) Open the "mvpd.cfg" with your favorite text editor.
8 ) Copy and Paste the following code, make sure you remove the spaces at the end of each line!
[code]Scheme: /hp/Videos/schemes/simple.scheme/ Movies@/hp/Videos/movies/ TV Shows@/hp/Videos/tvshows/ Viral Videos@/hp/Videos/viralVideos/ Music Videos@/hp/Videos/musicVideos/[/code]
9) "Save" the "mvpd.cfg" file to apply the changes you have made, and then go back into the "Videos" folder.
10) Add the following folders to the main "Videos" folder
[code]movies tvshows viralVideos musicVideos[/code]
11) Download [url=http://www.megaupload.com/?d=RLDPTSBI][b]This[/b][/url], it is a packet of a web-cartoon called "Happy Tree Friends".
12) "Save" this to your Desktop and "Extract" it.
13) Open the extracted folder and "Copy" the first episode.
14) Open "Videos"
15) Paste the first episode of "Happy Tree Friends" into the "viralVideos" folder.
16) Copy the "Videos" folder and "Paste" it into your iPod's root.
17) "Sync" or "Update" your iPod, eject it, and then unplug it.
18 ) Boot into Linux, and go into the "File Browser"
19) Select "hp"
20) Go into the "Videos" folder
21) Go into the "m_player_m"
22) Have fun!
Note: You can also download a scheme for Mv_Player made by me that makes it feel like you're in a movie theater! [url=http://ipodlinux.org/Mv_player/Schemes#Downloads][b]Available For Download From The Wiki Here![/b][/url]
----------------------
Troubleshooting For Videos
Problem: My video won't copy! It says "Incorrect Paremeter"!
Answer: Update your iPod, unplug it, and plug it back in. It should now copy. -----------
Problem: A stream of code comes down, and then it goes back to the File Browser!
Answer: Reboot, Click "Power" in the main Podzilla menu and hit "Reboot iPod"
-------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Converting Your Own Videos:
As you may have learned from the previous section of the tutorial, iPod Linux can play compressed .mvpd files.
1) Plug in your iPod, and make sure Disk Mode is enabled, and minimize iTunes
2) Download [url=http://www.consumption.net/user/greeze/ccount/click.php?id=19][b]This[/b][/url]
([url=http://www.mediafire.com/?dneb9mw0199][b]Mirror[/b][/url]
And [url=http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=0856EACB-4362-4B0D-8EDD-AAB15C5E04F5&displaylang=en][b]This[/b][/url]
3) Install both!
4) Once this is done, open Smoovepod
5) Drag your own videos into the bars (it supports almost all formats)
6) In the upper left corner, hit "Presets" then iPod Nano - Movie, or TV Shows, whatever you're converting.
7) For more advanced options, don't use the "Presets" button
8 ) Drag the slide bar to the left for smaller file size, or to the right for better quality, whatever you drag this to effects your video quality and size.
9) Hit "Start Encoding"
10) Once it is done, it will export your video to either your Desktop, or where-ever you dragged your video from.
11) Now change the name to "nano" (required)
12) Drag it into your iPod's root, and enjoy.
Note: You only need to change the name to Nano if you have the older version of mv_player. (If you followed this tutorial, you did)
Troubleshooting For Converting Videos
Problem: It won't convert no matter what I do!
Answer: iTunes videos, and certain format video files can't be converted. If all else fails... make sure you have the NET 2.0 framework and re-install Smoovepod. ----------------------
Problem: A stream of code comes down, and then it goes back to the File Browser!
Answer: Reboot, Click "Power" in the main Podzilla menu and hit "Reboot iPod"
----------------------------- -------------------
Converting Your Own Youtube Videos!
Really want free shows or your favorite Viral Videos on your iPod? Come here! This also works for Google Video, Metacafe, all kinds of places!
1) Make sure you followed all the tutorials concerning videos
2) Go [url=http://www.vixy.net][b]Here[/b][/url]
3) Also go to your favorite site for videos, like Youtube, Google Video, Metacafe.... etc.
4) Find a video you like, and copy the URL
5) Enter it into [url=http://www.vixy.net][b]Here[/b][/url]
6) Select "Convert to .avi" from the drop-down menu
7) Hit "Start" it will then download the Youtube video and convert it from .flv (Youtube format) to .avi
8 ) Open Smoovepod, and convert the video you just converted from Vixy to .mvpd format
9) Load it onto your iPod, and you're done!
Here are some good videos you can try:
The Simpsons, Treehouse Of Horror XVI:
[url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-2SeN_IDcG8][b]Download Here[/b][/url]
Family Guy, Ding Fries Are Done
[url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6IfH6dYZLzE][b]Download Here[/b][/url]
Charlie Goes To Candy Mountain!
[url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BFP0q4qzGw4][b]Download Here[/b][/url]
iBoy
1) Plug in your iPod, and make sure Disk Use is Enabled.
2) Download [url=http://ipodlinux.org/images/9/9c/Iboy3.3.zip][b]This[/b][/url]
3) Extract the contents to the desktop
3.1) Rename "iBoy3.3" "iboy"
4) Go through the folders and find the .cfg file
5) Copy it into your iPod's root, and the main folder
6) Place a rom in the "rom" folder. See below, or see [url=http://www.zophar.net/roms.phtml?op=show&type=gb][b]These[/b][/url] links.
Some more links are below, to the next post
7) Sync or "Update" iPod
8 ) Eject, unplug, and boot into iPod Linux (hold Menu and Center, then when the apple pops up hold down rewind)
9) Open "File Browser"
10) Go into "hp" then iboy
11) Open the "iboy" folder inside "iboy"
12) Select "iboy" inside "iboy" inside "iboy" *whew*
13) Use the Play/Pause and Menu buttons to highlight "Load Rom" then hit center
14) Hit the rom you want to play
Gameboy ROM Package:
It includes tons of playable roms to use under iBoy, all in one folder!
[url=http://psp-news.dcemu.co.uk/gameboy-gameboycolourroms.shtml][b] |Available For Download Here |[/b][/url]
Controls:
Up: Tap Menu Down: Tap Play/Pause Left: Tap Rewind Right: Tap Fast-Forward A: Tap the upper right part of the click-wheel B: Tap the upper left part of the click-wheel Start: Tap the lower right part of the click-wheel Select: Tap the lower left part of the click-wheel
Troubleshooting For iBoy:
Problem: A stream of code comes down, and then it goes back to the File Browser!
Answer: Reboot, Click "Power" in the main Podzilla menu and hit "Reboot iPod" --------- Problem: The ROM doesn't show up in the "Load ROM" menu!
Answer: It may not be a .gb file. If it is a Gameboy Color or Gameboy Advance game it won't work.
iGpsp Tutorial
1) Download [url=http://ipodlinux.unas.cz/allinone.zip][b]This[/b][/url]
2) If you LEGALLY OWN A GAMEBOY ADVANCE, then go to Google and search and download the gba_bios.
3) Put it in the folder you downloaded, and drag the entire folder in your iPod's root.
4) Once booted into Pz0, open the folder and click on "iGpsp"
5) Make sure you have a working rom in the folder, a list of working roms can be found [url=http://www.ipodlinux.org/igpsp/roms][b]Here[/b][/url]
6) Select the rom from the list, and hit the center button to begin playing.
7) Have Fun!
You have successfully gone through my entire tutorial! Check back every once and awhile for updates, and I also suggest trying other tutorials to get a taste of all the different kinds of things iPl has to offer. :D Feel free to put positive comments! Credits to blobinator11.

item.title: How to Install Linux on your Ipod Nano!
item.dc:creator: @ninja_nub ninja nub
item.description:
@ninja_nub wrote:

To start, I’ll kill all of you worries here!

“It is impossible to permanently damage your iPod by installing iPod Linux!”

Also, please make a note that this tutorial is meant for the iPod Nano. You may get success with this tutorial using another iPod, but I can’t guarantee it.

If you have an iPod Video, there’s a nice tutorial Here, and if you have an iPod Mini, you can find a tutorial Here. If you have an iPod not listed here, just search the forums or ask someone.

Ok, let’s get started

Note: If you don’t already have Winzip, get it Here (You probably have it already, so only download this if you have a problem Extracting files)

  1. Grab your iPod!

  2. Open iTunes, which should be on your desktop or in the start menu. If you don’t have it, grab the disc that came with your iPod and install it, or download the latest version Here
    (PM me if you need more explanation)

Note: Make sure you have iPod Software Version 1.3.1, PM me for more help.

  1. Once iTunes is open, plug in your iPod using your cable. Your iPod should pop-up, and click it in the source list.
    (PM me for extra help)

  2. Enable disk use, which is done by clicking “Enable Disk Use”. Once this is done, hit apply.

  3. Note: from now on, you MUST hit the eject button next to the iPod every time you want to unplug it, but wait until it is done updating of course! Unplug it when the screen on your iPod stops saying “Do Not Disconnect”. BUT DON’T UNPLUG IT NOW!

  4. Hit “Restore” and relax when it says it will restore your iPod to factory settings. This is ok! Here’s what will happen. First, it will reset your settings and take all the music off of your iPod. Next, you will install iPod Linux. After that, the music will get put back on, so make sure all of your music is stored on your computer. So basically, your ipod will be EXACTLY the same except for iPod Linux, which is only accessed if you choose so. As a matter of fact, if you don’t go into Linux on your iPod, it’s like it didn’t ever get installed. Hit “Ok” when the next message pops up, and wait until your iPod is restored. When it is, it will ask for the name of the iPod. Hit “Cancel”.

  5. EXIT out of iTunes, and open My Computer. It is usually on your desktop, though sometimes it is in the start menu. Select it, and somewhere there it should say “IPOD”.

  6. If it is there, then continue on. If not, go back to step 4, and do it again. If it doesn’t work, come to me for help.

  7. Download This, it is the official Linux Installer, but a different version.

8 ) Hit “Save” and save it on your Desktop. Wait for it to download, and then come back here.

  1. Right-click the file you downloaded, and hit “Extract All”. Hit next, let the bar load, then hit next and then finish. The file should pop-up. Exit out of the file.

  2. Time to install! Open the file again and double click on installer. It should pop-up, and hit next. There SHOULD be a Sysinfo error. This is a good thing! Well, not good, but we can fix it! If it says it couldn’t find anything that looked like an iPod, PM me for help. Ok, now for a little harder part. Close everything except this tutorial, and open “My Computer”. Double click on your iPod. You are now in the iPod’s root. (Make sure you are exited out of iTunes but did not unplug your iPod or eject it).

  3. Now that you are in the root, hit “Tools” at the top of the browser. Hit “Folder Options” and a screen should pop-up.

  4. Hit “View” at the top of this pop-up, and a new screen should pop-up!
    Scroll down, and hit “Show hidden files and folders”. Hit “Ok” at the bottom of the screen and go back to your iPod. Open it up, and you are in the root again.

  5. New folder! Do you see “iPod_Control”? If you do then good, if now, repeat steps 11 and 12. If it still doesn’t work, come to me for help. If it does, then double-click on “iPod_Control”. Once inside, it should have more folders. Double click on “Device”. Once inside, there should be a file called “SysInfo”. Right click on this file and hit “Open”. Select the program “Notepad” from the list and hit ok. A screen should pop-up with nothing on it. Copy and paste this in there, replace the “Serial Number Here” with the serial number on the back of your iPod, and then save it and exit.

Copy and Paste this:

BoardHwName: iPod M25
pszSerialNumber: SERIAL NUMBER GOES HERE
ModelNumStr: MA147
FirewireGuid: 0x000A2700148EDA63
HddFirmwareRev: BU011A
RegionCode: LL(0x0001)
PolicyFlags: 0x00000002
buildID: 0x06008000 (6.0)
visibleBuildID: 0x01008000 (1.0)
boardHwRev: 0x00000000 (0.0 0)
boardHwSwInterfaceRev: 0x000C0005 (0.0.11 5)
bootLoaderImageRev: 0x00000000 (0.0 0)
diskModeImageRev: 0x00000000 (0.0 0)
diagImageRev: 0x00000000 (0.0 0)
osImageRev: 0x00000000 (0.0 0)
iPodFamily: 0x00000000
updaterFamily: 0x00000000

  1. Ok, exit out of everything except this tutorial, and go back into the installer (the thing you downloaded) and hit “Installer” again.

  2. Hit “Next”, and it should say “We have detected a Nano” blah blah blah blah. Hit next.

  3. Uncheck “Make A Backup” at the bottom of the screen and hit next.

  4. Then, it should install. This takes awhile, so you can leave if you want.

18 ) After awhile, it should pop-up a congradulations message. If it pops up a Windows error, then PM me for help. Hit “Finish”.

  1. iPod Linux is now installed on your iPod! Open up iTunes again, and the same screen should pop-up. Enter the iPod’s name, yada yada, and it should put all of your music on there. Once it is done, select your iPod in the list again, and “Enable Disk Use”, once again.

  2. You now have iPod Linux installed!

  3. Hit the eject button next to your iPod in the source list and when your iPod’s screen stops saying “Do Not Disconnect” then disconnect it. It should have you select a language, and your iPod will be back to normal. Where’s the Linux? First, go into your music and play 1 song to make sure it works. If it doesn’t then come to me and I will fix it. If it works, then stop the song and hold down the “Menu” and “Center” button at the same time. Nothing should happen for a second, but then your iPod should black out. When a silver apple appears, hold rewind. When a bunch of text comes up, release “Rewind”. It should pause for a second, and then go to a new menu. Hold “Menu” for a second and the backlight should turn on. You can change its timer in “Settings”. Go into “Extras” and have some fun in there. Once your done, go to the main screen and hit “Power” then “Reboot Ipod” then “Absolutely” and it will go back to your normal iPod.

Linux Troubleshooting

“When I select “Reboot iPod” it boots right back into iPod Linux!”

It’s important that when the iPod is rebooting that you don’t touch ANYTHING! Like, don’t even look at it! Well, while you can look at it, it is possible to boot into Linux just by breathing on the click-wheel.

iDoom Tutorial:

Note: You MAY need to fix the VT Switching to get this to work.
PM me for help.

  1. Download This

If you need extra help, PM me

  1. Extract this to the root of your iPod (remember this from before?) If not, PM me.

  2. Take all the folders you extracted and put them in a new folder called “iDoom”

  3. Sync your iPod (update on earlier versions) and then eject it.

  4. Boot iPod Linux, and hit “File Browser”

  5. Go into “iPod_Control”

  6. Hit “Parent Directory”

8 ) Select the “iDoom” folder

  1. Go inside it, and hit “iDoom” not “iDoom.cfg”, etc.

Note: My way of getting into iDoom (through iPod_Control) is my way to get to “iDoom” even though not many people do it that way. If it doesn’t work, get to it through “hp” in the file browser menu.

iDoom Troubleshooting

Problem: A stream of code comes down, and then it goes back to the File Browser!

Answer: Reboot, Click “Power” in the main Podzilla menu and hit “Reboot iPod”

Make Your Own Custom iDoom Maps!

  1. Get Doom Builder Here

  2. Download this to the Desktop

  3. Download the iDoom original folder again (it can be found in the iDoom tutorial section)

  4. Extract the iDoom folder and the Doom Builder folder

  5. Install Doom Builder, and copy and paste the .wad in the folder “iDoom” to the Desktop.

  6. Right click the .wad, go to “Open With” and select “Doom Builder”.

  7. When the next screen pops-up, pull down the drop down menu at the top of the window and select “Doom”.

8 ) Hit “Ok” and ignore the IWAD error messages

  1. Edit your map, just toy around to get the feel for Doom Builder, try starting off by adding or editing some items.

  2. When you’re done editing, hit “Save” and ignore the IWAD error messages.

  3. On the Desktop, your edited .wad as well as a backup file should be there.

  4. Delete the backup file

  5. Plug in your iPod, and go into the root

  6. Replace your current .wad in the folder “iDoom” with the one you just edited.

  7. Boot into iPod Linux, go into “hp” and then select the folder “iDoom”

  8. To enter iDoom, select the file “iDoom”, not the “iDoom” configuration file.

  9. Have fun!

Troubleshooting For Making Your Own Custom iDoom Maps!

Problem: The game freezes!

Answer: Something is wrong with your map

Problem: A stream of code comes down, and then it goes back to the File Browser!

Answer: Reboot, Click “Power” in the main Podzilla menu and hit “Reboot iPod”

Video Tutorial

  1. Download This is has everything you need, except for videos!

  2. “Save” it to the Desktop of your computer

  3. Once it is downloaded, “Extract” the compressed folder you just downloaded.

  4. Rename the “Extracted” folder “Videos”

  5. Open “Videos”

  6. Delete the “sMooVePoD0.7” folder

  7. Open the “mvpd.cfg” with your favorite text editor.

8 ) Copy and Paste the following code, make sure you remove the spaces at the end of each line!

Scheme: /hp/Videos/schemes/simple.scheme/ Movies@/hp/Videos/movies/ TV Shows@/hp/Videos/tvshows/ Viral Videos@/hp/Videos/viralVideos/ Music Videos@/hp/Videos/musicVideos/

  1. “Save” the “mvpd.cfg” file to apply the changes you have made, and then go back into the “Videos” folder.

  2. Add the following folders to the main “Videos” folder

movies tvshows viralVideos musicVideos

  1. Download This, it is a packet of a web-cartoon called “Happy Tree Friends”.

  2. “Save” this to your Desktop and “Extract” it.

  3. Open the extracted folder and “Copy” the first episode.

  4. Open “Videos”

  5. Paste the first episode of “Happy Tree Friends” into the “viralVideos” folder.

  6. Copy the “Videos” folder and “Paste” it into your iPod’s root.

  7. “Sync” or “Update” your iPod, eject it, and then unplug it.

18 ) Boot into Linux, and go into the “File Browser”

  1. Select “hp”

  2. Go into the “Videos” folder

  3. Go into the “m_player_m”

  4. Have fun!

Note: You can also download a scheme for Mv_Player made by me that makes it feel like you’re in a movie theater! Available For Download From The Wiki Here!

Troubleshooting For Videos

Problem: My video won’t copy! It says “Incorrect Paremeter”!

Answer: Update your iPod, unplug it, and plug it back in. It should now copy.

Problem: A stream of code comes down, and then it goes back to the File Browser!

Answer: Reboot, Click “Power” in the main Podzilla menu and hit “Reboot iPod”

Converting Your Own Videos:

As you may have learned from the previous section of the tutorial, iPod Linux can play compressed .mvpd files.

  1. Plug in your iPod, and make sure Disk Mode is enabled, and minimize iTunes

  2. Download This

(Mirror

And This

  1. Install both!

  2. Once this is done, open Smoovepod

  3. Drag your own videos into the bars (it supports almost all formats)

  4. In the upper left corner, hit “Presets” then iPod Nano - Movie, or TV Shows, whatever you’re converting.

  5. For more advanced options, don’t use the “Presets” button

8 ) Drag the slide bar to the left for smaller file size, or to the right for better quality, whatever you drag this to effects your video quality and size.

  1. Hit “Start Encoding”

  2. Once it is done, it will export your video to either your Desktop, or where-ever you dragged your video from.

  3. Now change the name to “nano” (required)

  4. Drag it into your iPod’s root, and enjoy.

Note: You only need to change the name to Nano if you have the older version of mv_player. (If you followed this tutorial, you did)

Troubleshooting For Converting Videos

Problem: It won’t convert no matter what I do!

Answer: iTunes videos, and certain format video files can’t be converted. If all else fails… make sure you have the NET 2.0 framework and re-install Smoovepod.

Problem: A stream of code comes down, and then it goes back to the File Browser!

Answer: Reboot, Click “Power” in the main Podzilla menu and hit “Reboot iPod”

Converting Your Own Youtube Videos!

Really want free shows or your favorite Viral Videos on your iPod? Come here! This also works for Google Video, Metacafe, all kinds of places!

  1. Make sure you followed all the tutorials concerning videos

  2. Go Here

  3. Also go to your favorite site for videos, like Youtube, Google Video, Metacafe… etc.

  4. Find a video you like, and copy the URL

  5. Enter it into Here

  6. Select “Convert to .avi” from the drop-down menu

  7. Hit “Start” it will then download the Youtube video and convert it from .flv (Youtube format) to .avi

8 ) Open Smoovepod, and convert the video you just converted from Vixy to .mvpd format

  1. Load it onto your iPod, and you’re done!

Here are some good videos you can try:

The Simpsons, Treehouse Of Horror XVI:

Download Here

Family Guy, Ding Fries Are Done

Download Here

Charlie Goes To Candy Mountain!

Download Here

iBoy

  1. Plug in your iPod, and make sure Disk Use is Enabled.

  2. Download This

  3. Extract the contents to the desktop

3.1) Rename “iBoy3.3” “iboy”

  1. Go through the folders and find the .cfg file

  2. Copy it into your iPod’s root, and the main folder

  3. Place a rom in the “rom” folder. See below, or see These links.

Some more links are below, to the next post

  1. Sync or “Update” iPod

8 ) Eject, unplug, and boot into iPod Linux (hold Menu and Center, then when the apple pops up hold down rewind)

  1. Open “File Browser”

  2. Go into “hp” then iboy

  3. Open the “iboy” folder inside “iboy”

  4. Select “iboy” inside “iboy” inside “iboy” whew

  5. Use the Play/Pause and Menu buttons to highlight “Load Rom” then hit center

  6. Hit the rom you want to play

Gameboy ROM Package:

It includes tons of playable roms to use under iBoy, all in one folder!

|Available For Download Here |

Controls:

Up: Tap Menu
Down: Tap Play/Pause
Left: Tap Rewind
Right: Tap Fast-Forward
A: Tap the upper right part of the click-wheel
B: Tap the upper left part of the click-wheel
Start: Tap the lower right part of the click-wheel
Select: Tap the lower left part of the click-wheel

Troubleshooting For iBoy:

Problem: A stream of code comes down, and then it goes back to the File Browser!

Answer: Reboot, Click “Power” in the main Podzilla menu and hit “Reboot iPod”

Problem: The ROM doesn’t show up in the “Load ROM” menu!

Answer: It may not be a .gb file. If it is a Gameboy Color or Gameboy Advance game it won’t work.

iGpsp Tutorial

  1. Download This

  2. If you LEGALLY OWN A GAMEBOY ADVANCE, then go to Google and search and download the gba_bios.

  3. Put it in the folder you downloaded, and drag the entire folder in your iPod’s root.

  4. Once booted into Pz0, open the folder and click on “iGpsp”

  5. Make sure you have a working rom in the folder, a list of working roms can be found Here

  6. Select the rom from the list, and hit the center button to begin playing.

  7. Have Fun!

You have successfully gone through my entire tutorial! Check back every once and awhile for updates, and I also suggest trying other tutorials to get a taste of all the different kinds of things iPl has to offer. Feel free to put positive comments! Credits to blobinator11.

item.source: How to Install Linux on your Ipod Nano!
